item.title: Lisa add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Lisa add a quote by John Paul II
item.description: "As the family goes, so goes the nation and so goes the whole world in which we live." -- John Paul II

item.title: Lisa add a quote by John Paul II
item.description: "Freedom consists not in doing what we like, but in having the right to do what we <i>ought.</i>" -- John Paul II

item.title: Lisa add a quote by John Paul II
item.description: "Stupidity is also a gift of God, but one mustn't misuse it." -- John Paul II

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Look for God. Look for God like a man with his head on fire looks for water." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What a treacherous thing to believe that a person is more than a person." -- John Green

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Sometimes people are beautiful. Not in looks. Not in what they say. Just in what they are." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Lisa add a quote by John Green
item.description: "God I love rainbows." -- John Green

item.title: Lisa add a quote by John Green
item.description: "…because nerds like us are allowed to be unironically enthusiastic about stuff… Nerds are allowed to love stuff, like jump-up-and-down-in-the-chair-can’t-control-yourself love it. Hank, when people call people nerds, mostly what they’re saying is ‘you like stuff.’ Which is just not a good insult at all. Like, ‘you are too enthusiastic about the miracle of human consciousness’." -- John Green

item.title: Lisa add a quote by John Green
item.description: "When did we see each other face-to-face? Not until you saw into my cracks and I saw into yours. Before that, we were just looking at ideas of each other, like looking at your window shade but never seeing inside. But once the vessel cracks, the light can get in. The light can get out." -- John Green

item.title: Lisa add a quote by John Green
item.description: "It is easy to forget how full the world is of people, full to bursting, and each of them imaginable and consistently misimagined." -- John Green

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Lisa add a quote by John Green
item.description: "The venn diagram of boys who don’t like smart girls and boys you don’t wanna date is a circle." -- John Green

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "One must always be careful of books," said Tessa, "and what is inside them, for words have the power to change us." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Meg Rosoff
item.description: "I don't get nearly enough credit in life for the things I manage not to say." -- Meg Rosoff

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Lisa add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "You're in the right place at the right time, and you care enough to do what needs to be done. Sometimes that's enough." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Lisa add a quote by John Green
Lisa add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "We too are called to withdraw at certain intervals into deeper silence and aloneness with God, together as a community as well as personally; to be alone with Him — not with our books, thoughts, and memories but completely stripped of everything — to dwell lovingly in His presence, silent, empty, expectant, and motionless. We cannot find God in noise or agitation." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Lisa add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You and me will read a book and find three interesting things that we remember. But Colin finds everything intriguing. He reads a book about presidents and he remembers more of it because everything he reads clicks in his head as fugging interesting." -- John Green

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Pamela Morsi
item.description: "I never heard of a pretty librarian in my life,” Paula declared." -- Pamela Morsi

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Pamela Morsi
item.description: "Marrying the right girl is the single most important ingredient for a happy life,” he’d also said." -- Pamela Morsi

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Danielle Bean
item.description: "In the family, women have the opportunity to transmit the faith in the early training of their children. They are particularly responsible for the joyful task of leading them to discover the supernatural world.” ~Bl. John Paul II" -- Danielle Bean

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Danielle Bean
item.description: "To keep the soul continually in a state of gentle calm, it is necessary to perform every action as being done in the presence of God, and as if he himself had ordained it.” ~St. Francis de Sales" -- Danielle Bean

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Helen Fielding
item.description: "But the thing about having kids is: you can’t go to pieces; you just have to keep going." -- Helen Fielding
